stories.title: U.S. pundits: Please stop trying to concede on Ukraine's behalf

stories.text:
You can't go a day, without seeing worrying "news." From the Federal Reserve raising rates, making mortgages more "unaffordable" to this summer leading in the most decrease "mortgage applications" since 2006. https://www.mpamag.com/us/mortgage-industry/market-updates/mortgage-applications-decrease-in-latest-mba-weekly-survey/408097

On the other hand, commercial real estate has their own problem, prime commercial space goes unleased, and majority of downtown cores are still empty, or heavily decreased occupancy.

I'm on the opinion of, if you need a house, buy a house - because you do need a place to live.

Yet, decreased supply, higher cost of loans and loan servicing seem to make it mirror 2006 - yet, mortgages are stronger than ever - but what about those covid mortgage forbearances?

What do all of you think?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it the “worst” time to buy a house?

Do Kwon says claims he cashed out $2.7B are categorically false

stories.text:
Over the past couple of years mechanical keyboards have soared in popularity among engineers. Rightfully so! Owning a custom piece of beautifully crafted equipment is delightful!

However if you own one of the loud ones and want to be considerate to your coworkers, I implore you to not use them at the office. The sound is so loud it pierces through noise cancelling headphones, and it's not fun to have to blast music all day just to cover up the sounds of typing.

There are some options if you want a quieter mechanical keyboard (https://www.electronicshub.org/best-quiet-mechanical-keyboards/) or you can get the o-rings to dampen the sound of the switches on your current model (https://www.amazon.ca/dp/B00K73IE1C).

Truly not trying to be a dick writing this, I really get the excitement! But the sound has been driving me up the wall, and I can't be the only one.
stories.title: Tell HN: Don't bring your loud mechanical keyboard to the office
